title: David Lynch, visionary filmmaker behind 'Twin Peaks' and 'Mulholland Drive,' dies at 78
summary: Lynch broke through in the 1970s with the surreal 'Eraserhead' and rarely failed to startle and inspire audiences and peers in the following decades.

title: French PM survives first no-confidence vote
summary: The challenge in the Assemblée Nationale came after François Bayrou's statement this week on his government policy agenda. The no-confidence motion, brought by the leftist opposition, failed to gain support from the far right.

title: Netanyahu postpones Cabinet vote on Gaza Strip ceasefire deal
summary: Netanyahu's office accused Hamas of reneging on parts of the agreement in an attempt to gain further concessions – without specifying which parts.

title: 'Trump believes, like Putin, that the strong are destined to gobble up the weak'
summary: In an interview, Zaki Laïdi, professor of international relations at Sciences Po, says that 'Europe can never undertake anything that runs counter to American interests.'

title: Musk's SpaceX loses spacecraft after catching rocket booster at the launch pad in latest Starship test
summary: Hours earlier in Florida, another billionaire's rocket company – Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin – launched the newest supersized rocket, New Glenn. The rocket reached orbit on its first flight, successfully placing an experimental satellite thousands of miles above Earth.

title: Sweden's all-out tightening of migration policy
summary: As asylum and immigration figures continued to fall in 2024, the right and far right, in power since September 2022, have continued to make announcements aimed at tightening reception conditions in the Scandinavian kingdom.

title: US recovers $31 million in federal payments to dead people
summary: The effort has shown areas where the government is preventing fraud, waste and abuse – which is also one of Donald Trump's campaign promises.

title: Cuba: NGOs fear deceptive release of political prisoners
summary: The Havana regime has released around 20 detainees following Washington's announcement that the island has been removed from the list of state sponsors of terrorism.

title: 'Beyond the conflicts that may oppose them, Putin, Trump and Xi have much in common'
summary: The renewal the three leaders have promised to their peoples requires the domination of other peoples, starting with their neighbors. All three have professed territorial claims, writes Le Monde's Alain Frachon.

title: Hamas, even diminished by 15 months of war, remains a force to be reckoned with in Gaza
summary: The Palestinian Islamist movement has managed to maintain its hold on the Gaza Strip, now ravaged by the Israeli offensive.

title: In Paris's Latin Quarter, a historic building becomes a huge luxury hotel
summary: Owned by British company Edyn, Le Jardin de Verre is one of the largest hotel projects in Paris. Its opening reflects the attractiveness of the sector in the French capital.

title: Jeff Bezos' New Glenn rocket reaches orbit on first test flight
summary: All seven main engines fired at liftoff as the rocket blazed through the predawn sky to the delight of spectators lining nearby beaches.

title: In Los Angeles, firefighters battle the 'crazy' wind fanning the flames
summary: As controversy rages over the means allocated to combating the blazes, firefighters on the ground are testifying to the extraordinary nature of the firestorm that has hit the US's second-largest city.

title: 'The US has swung from fighting global warming to championing artificial intelligence'
summary: Donald Trump and Elon Musk want to destabilize Europe. But Europe, which has been stalling since the turn of the century, is largely responsible for its ill-fated destiny, argues Arnaud Leparmentier.

title: The foreshadowing in Mark Zuckerberg's transformation as both CEO and influencer
summary: While recent statements by the Meta CEO have been much commented upon, the revolution in his style had foreshadowed his ideological shift for several months, Pauline Croquet argues.

title: When industry manipulates science to prevent a PFAS ban
summary: A scientific article funded by an American lobbying organization for the chemical industry, widely quoted by stakeholders to influence decision-makers, illustrates a wider strategy to create doubt.

title: In farewell address, Joe Biden warns against rise of 'oligarchy'
summary: The US president bid farewell to 50 years of public life.

title: Paris memorial for far-right French leader Jean-Marie Le Pen held under tight security
summary: Over 1,000 attended the mass for the far-right political figure, including his daughter far-right politician Marine Le Pen.

title: In Los Angeles, architecture goes up in flames
summary: The list of sites, buildings and architect's houses destroyed by fire is growing longer by the day, testifying to the disappearance of a precious heritage.

title: Trump readies for triumphant inauguration
summary: The only thing that could spoil the billionaire president-elect's party of star guests is the weather, with a potentially lethal 'polar vortex' threatening to make his inauguration the coldest in 40 years. Extreme weather could force the ceremony indoors.

title: Etienne-Emile Baulieu, father of the abortion pill: 'Women's right to a safe abortion is irreversible'
summary: In 1982, the researcher discovered the RU-486 molecule, a medicinal solution to surgical abortion. As France is celebrating the 50th anniversary of legalizing abortion on January 17, the 98-year-old professor recalls the virulent lobbying against the sale of his invention.

title: In Senegal, the authorities want to do away with French street names
summary: President Bassirou Diomaye Faye called for certain main roads bearing colonial names to be renamed in honor of 'national heroes.'

title: US trade envoy finds China's shipbuilding policies warrant 'urgent action'
summary: A decision on what actions to take would be considered in the next stage of the US probe. On Thursday, Alliance for American Manufacturing President Scott Paul applauded the pursuit of the investigation.

title: Netanyahu's office says cabinet to meet on Friday over ceasefire after hostage deal finalized
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had accused Hamas of reneging on key parts of the agreement to extort last-minute concessions, which delayed talks.

title: The mysterious island of photographer Henry Roy
summary: From his Haitian roots to his travels around the world, the 61-year-old artist has never stopped putting his intimate quest for a metaphorical insularity into images. His world, currently on display in Perth, Australia, is accompanied by a beautiful book featuring a selection of shots.
